fields.summary: Allow spaces in euctl to allow copy & paste

fields.description: In EUCA-12692 we discovered that euctl interprets {{=}} or any other string that begins with that character as a request to set a variable with no name, which results in an error: {code} % euctl '=f' --debug 2017-01-10 13:26:42,648 DEBUG Euctl parsed arguments from CLI: {'reset': False, 'show_defaults': False, 'security_token': None, 'dump': False, 'all_types': False, 'format': fields.summary: euctl tries to set nameless variables

comments.body: Commit {{3ec1976}} makes euctl ignore variable assignments that lack names, such as "{{=}}" and "{{=foo}}".

Fix Verified.

Verified with {{euctl '=f' --debug}} and observing no error.

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.4.0
Release     : 0.25761.132.20170123gitf4d0c0b.el7
Moving 4.4.0 Issues from Release Pending to Resolved
